content.question: What is the volume of the solid generated when the circular region bounded by the graph of <math alttext="x squared, plus y squared, equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved around the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? (It is known that <math alttext="the integral from, negative 1 to 1, of, the square root of 1 minus x squared, end root, d x, equals, the fraction pi over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>.)

topic.text: 8.12: Volume with Washer Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
